title: Re: 01:02:03 04/05/06
content:
Slashes are for the American notation for dates (which is crap).
Use dashes for the proper notation, 04-05-2006.
It's annoying when those get mixed up, since (unless there is a number higher than 12, or both numbers are identical) it's impossible to see to which date someone is referring.

As for any Americans being insulted by my "crap" comment, I do think the American way for writing large numbers is superior.
"10000000000 and a half" is pretty much unreadable, but we Europeans add dots to make it easier, and decimal numbers we use a squigly thingy for... that's stupid!
10.000.000.000,5

A comma is a short pause, a period is a full stop.
In my opinion a meaningless making-it-more-readable-character has a lot more in common with a short pause, and a divising-regular-and-decimal-numbers-character then better fits the full stop!
Whomever thought up the Euro method?
10,000,000,000.5 makes a lot more sense.
Using half spaces to seperate make large numbers more readable is acceptable as well.

Uhm, what was this topic about again?Retodon8

Though I find the Gregorian calendar far too arbitrary to make too big a deal of these things (apart from Keen day, of course, but that's completely different).

I agree entirely about the dots and commas, Ret. I didn't even know of the convention x.xxx.xxx,xx until I started coming across it in the past couple of years. Is 1,03 actually pronounced 'One point zero three'? That would just be wrong.

title: Hmm.
content:
Actually, assuming the Aztec calendar isn't vastly different from the Mayan one [I've not researched much of the former], it's to do with the cycles of the entire galaxy. The ages are based around certain alignments, most notably regarding the centre of the galaxy.

I've not heard any of these so-called prophesies you're ranting about of fire and the end of the world and whatnot. The only theory I've heard is that a great cycle comes to a close on December 22, 2012, ushering forth a new Golden Age. However, that same theory also states that it's up to us to make what we will of it, that it's a blank slate yet to be written.

title: Re: Hmm.
content:
Well ys Mayan is slightly different, but then again, look at the church.

Still, it sure wasn't a golden age for em now was it? But you've got to admit its a good prophecy; no guarantees of eternal bliss, I guess their prophecies were as advenced as their calendar.

Sadly, it appears the Martians has different ideas; according to the Gargalic calendar, quite a few hundred years ago was ordained by the gods as a time of war and destruction. They thus travelled to the nearest planet and eliminated a civilisation.

Nobody missed atlantis, but the Aztecs, well, actually, since they spent a lot of time killing people, nobody missed them either.
